section.title: Welcome to redBorder v.3- IPS Community: Generating community day-to-day
section.para: Thank you very much for downloading rb_IPS_v.3-Community and welcome to the redBorder Community.

We are pleased to introduce this new version of one of our star products: the intrusion prevention system (IPS), which together with the Flow, packets are found available on our website http://redborder.net/downloads-ips-community/ for free download.
All our products are Open Source, as one of the cornerstones of redBorder is to promote and generate community.
Thanks to our community, we have the opportunity to constantly innovate and grow through the exchange of ideas, contributions and other uses developers do with our code.

Therefore, first of all, we want to give thanks. Innovation is only possible if knowledge is shared. We grow with contributions from experts like you. We can test and validate our products internally and offer improvements to accommodate new needs.

section.title: Knowing the Official Guide to Installing IPS redBorder v.3-Community
section.para: This guide contains useful information that will help complete the installation of our redBorder IPS solution correctly. In this first chapter you will find some tips for using this guide. Read them carefully as they can be very useful when applying the concepts presented in this manual. The Official Guide to Installation redBorder v.3- IPS Community will provide the knowledge necessary for the installation of our redBorder IPS solution which consists of three steps:

section.title: How to use this manual
section.para: This manual is designed for the implementation of the solution redBorder IPS Community version from the download file containing the installation ISO. This document is ideal for both users wishing to replace the old version, as well as those who are installing the redBorder IPS 3 Community for the first time.

If you are already one of our users and have completed the installation of both the redBorder IPS and Manager at another time, you may go directly to Chapters 3 and 5 for installation of Manager and IPS Sensors.

section.title: Requirements for the installation of redBorder IPS solution Community version
section.para: The installation of redBorder IPS solution Community Edition v.3 requires compliance with certain requirements to ensure correct settings and optimal functioning.
There are two ways to do the installation of our redBorder IPS solution:

important.title: Important
important.para: redBorder Installation Requirements for the Manager on a physical computer:
Memory and Storage: 60GB hard drive and a minimum of 12GB of RAM. (This figure depends on the number of allocated sensors).

para.emphasis: At least one interface network for the Manager to operate.

section.title: Structure and operation of menus user interface Setup
section.para: Menu Setup responds to a pattern repeated in almost all screens:

Menu on the left side of the screen for a listing with the available options. To select any of them they must be entered in the line Selection, the number or letter corresponding to the option you want to choose.
If you would like to perform different actions select submenu. It will appear on the right side of the screen.

in the top margin, and separated from the menu and sub graph, find the area in which they should indicate selections on the line that contains Selection and enter commands or data requested to perform the appropriate actions. In this area the date and time of the system can be visualized (default UTC).

section.title: Selecting Options
section.para: In some cases of default options, the system will display a series of default options.
If this is the answer to a particular question, the defined default option will be displayed in uppercase.

para.emphasis: Options available in the redBorder installer menu

listitem.para: Other options: enter the letter or command that corresponds.
Quit: when you want to exit a screen to return to the main menu select the quit, option by entering the letter q.
Apply Changes: to save and apply the changes made, select apply by entering a.

warning.title: Caution
warning.para: If you see this message you must select the option a. Otherwise, the system will not store nor apply the changes.
